Message.Title: I'm Worried about Paul Ryan
Message.Msg: He is Washington's ONLY politician that has come out and said: "here is what we need to do to avoid becomming another Greece"... ... and proposed what needs to be done... in many cases taking ideas directly from the deficit reduction task force that Obama HIMSELF appointed... ... and then ignored after it released it's findings. Ryan proposed the tough measures we need to reduce the Trillion dollar deficits that are bankrupting our country... do we embrace that boldness, or do we respond from the upcoming surge of attacks that Obama is about to unleash... ... the "throwing grandma over the cliff" attacks and the "taking food from children" attacks we all know are coming. Obama's only real proposal is to jack up taxes on those with investment capital (eg: the wealthy and corporations). His proposal, if enacted, would reduce the budget deficits by about 7 or 8%... ... Ryans proposals would address 10 times as much of the deficit and wouldn't run investment capital out of the country and into tax shelters like Obama's bash-the-wealthy proposals would do... ... investment capital that we need to deploy HERE in America to build AMERICAN businesses and employ AMERICANS. I fear that Obama will succeed in scaring the bejeebers out of Americans who vote on their knee-jerk reactions to one-liner, fear-inducing political sound bites... ... and you can bet that Obama is about to unleash a torrent of scare ads about Paul Ryan... the only guy in Washington who see's the problems of Greece in our future and want's to do something about it NOW.

Topic.Title: Romney Ryan: "Lower Tax for the Rich, Ask middle and Lower Classes to Pay.

Message.Msg: ... of America's personal federal income taxes. The bottom 49% of Americans currently pay no federal income tax. Obama want's to jack up the taxes on the top 1% to between 43 and 48% of the individual tax revenues paid. Romney Ryan want to tax the wealthy and corporations at rates that are globally competitive for attracting investment capital and compelling them to deploy that investment capital into jobs-producing business investments... which they are not doing now due to fear of Obama's proposals (eg: the static 8.3% un-employment rate is the result of that fear). I don't think the bottom 49% of Americans should be exempted from contributing to us finding a way to not become another Greece. I also think that another 49% fact... 49% of american households receive some form of government assistance... is too much. We could go a long way toward avoiding the results of Greece if 38% of Americans paid no income tax and if just 40% of American households received some form of government assistance... ... that is what Ryan proposes... and I support that.
